meanings.definition: To surpass in humor or wit.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outhumor everyone with her quick jokes.
meanings.sent2: He can outhumor anyone in the room with his hilarious stories.
meanings.sent3: His ability to outhumor others makes every gathering more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her wit can outhumor even the most seasoned comedians.
meanings.sent5: Watching him outhumor his friends is always a treat.

meanings.definition: A person who surpasses others in humor or wit.
meanings.sent1: She is known as the outhumor of the group for her funny anecdotes.
meanings.sent2: He is the outhumor of the office, always making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The outhumor of the party had everyone in stitches with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Being the outhumor of the family, she keeps everyone entertained.
meanings.sent5: The outhumor of the class had a knack for making even the grumpiest teacher smile.
